website_summaries.verdict: A premium double-leg bicycle kickstand that won't break your budget.
pros: Black adjustable and foldable kickstand is sleek and simple to use
Designed to protect bike chains from getting caught when lowering the kickstand to the ground
Ideal for city, road, mountain, and trekking bikes
Can be installed in just minutes
cons: Kickstand is less durable than many comparable options
Not intended for use with e-bikes

customer_reviews.title: Bike falls over if there's any cross slope or irregular ground
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty cool, but it doesn't really hold my bike any sturdier than a regular kickstand (read the first comment to see how I might have made it work better.) In fact, I took it off and went back to my 1980's kickstand. Watch the video and you'll see the need for a flat level surface to make it work properly. I could see this being nice if you had a child seat on the front or back and you wanted to park the bike completely upright. But other than that, I'm not sure what problem this solves that a regular kickstand doesn't already handle.
customer_reviews.author: Brighton West

customer_reviews.title: This kickstand is stable. I have it on my ...
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand is stable. I have it on my Giant mountain bike which tows a Weehoo kid trailer. I can load my son on his trailer seat and secure his seat belts without a problem. Also works on grass and even on semi-soft dirt.
customer_reviews.author: D. tusaw

customer_reviews.title: Worse than the kickstand that comes with the bike
customer_reviews.text: I often use my bike to carry cargo, so I like to replace the standard kickstand with something that provides more stability. Unfortunately, my previous double leg stand (which I really liked) no longer had enough clearance when I switched to larger tires. I was hoping this kickstand would work, but I was wrong. The bike was very unstable and fell over several times even when unloaded. Just turning the handlebars the wrong way was enough to make it prone to tipping. I would not recommend this kickstand at all.
customer_reviews.author: DZ1073

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly on my Schwinn Sierra 21!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install on my Schwinn Sierra 21. The legs didn't require any height adjustment from stock. Rear wheel is raised about 1.5 inches off the ground, perfect for working on rear brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Yang

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your bike steady and secure standing up
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy kickstand. Liked it so much I got a second for my daughter's bike going off to college. You lift the bike up by the seat, flip down the legs, and rest it solidly on the v-shaped kickstand. It's a lot more balanced that the typical leaning to one side kickstand. The height is adjustable, though I should note that my daughter's tall size Cannondale hybrid was on the lowest setting and the front wheel stays off the ground a little bit. My own medium size Cannondale mountain bike had to go out a few holes. It didn't occur to me that the taller bike would also be lower to the ground. Anyway, solid product, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SCB

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand, but be carefull about installation (read below.)
customer_reviews.text: Improved design from the first one I bought. This works very well but there is a caveat: Because the body is an aluminum casting, the steel attachment screw, if slightly loose, will chew up the threads in the casting. Eventually the stand will come loose, even falling off the bike. (This happened to me. Fortunately it didn't go through the rear spokes.) The way to prevent this is to use a thread locking compound on the attachment bolt, and check the tightness of the bolt periodically, after every ride if you ride on rough terrain.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Martinek

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, sturdy, no gimmicks kind of kickstand. It folds up flush to the frame when you ride and isn't even remotely in danger of getting in the way of anything. When it is folded down and in use, your bike has a stability that I never saw before with the old 'peg leg' kickstand that we all probably grew up with. I am the least mechanically inclined person you will find and I had no problems installing it myself. It's so elegant the way it folds out when you go to use it as a stand, you find yourself playing with it several times just to marvel at it. I am glad I found this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Trustworthy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Works as advertised. When my bike is fully loaded with gear, it tops off about 150 lb over the bikes weight. This kickstand supports the bike solidly and does not feel tippy at all. Highly recommended especially due to price point compared to more expensive kickstands
customer_reviews.author: UltraFlyGuy

customer_reviews.title: Nice 2 legged feature
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice and very quality, the only real issue I found is when the kickstand is up, the part that is mounted things down about 3 inches, I found this to be too low hanging, great concept, other than that it is very different than any other 2 legged kickstand, when the kickstand is up, both legs move together on go up on the opposite side of the chain, this a very great feature, I really do like this kickstand but since it hangs too low, I will be returning, would recommend if someone does not mind how low it hangs
customer_reviews.author: dudis2dudis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit! Mongoose Beast 26" Fat Bike
customer_reviews.text: The stock kickstand on this bike was useless, the bike always fell over. This bike is heavy (almost 50 lbs.) and the weight would overcome the spring tension in the kickstand and over it would go. This stand fit the welded pad for the kickstand just like stock, and the Allen socket bolt (supplied) was the correct length. I adjusted the feet 4 holes down from the top. Works perfectly! The Beast sits upright, securely balanced. I was concerned the stand would rub the 4" fat tires, but no worries plenty of clearance. Pedals are OK too, feet have no interference issues on my short test ride. Looks trick, Problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Auto Tech Instructor

customer_reviews.title: but at half the price it is great for a cruiser bike
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a tandem bike that wouldn’t always stand with the stock single stand. This kickstand is really stable, I set it on the driveway at different angles and on the grass and it remained stable. It may be slightly heavier than the Pletscher that I was comparing it against, but at half the price it is great for a cruiser bike. It looks really nice and comes with both a long, standard bolt and a socket cap bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 2nd use and damaged my bike
customer_reviews.text: I installed this kickstand as instructed onto an adult Specialized mountain bike. On the second use, I parked my bike on a level paved surface with the kickstand engaged. About 5 minutes later, the kickstand cracked in half at the neck from just the weight of my bike and caused my bike to come crashing to the ground sending the kickstand and the mounting plate flying into the air! Now I have a scratched up bike and a broken and useless kickstand. I really had high hopes for this product, but unfortunately it seems to be made from very brittle materials that cannot hold much weight at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kona408

customer_reviews.title: Decent design, weak materials, worse customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this, worked very well for about 8 months. I noticed it was coming loose, so I went to tighten it and the main bolt stripped out from the base mount. On inspection, the bolt provided could only seat about five threads in, and the housing let go. I've since emailed BK twice, and have never heard from them. Non-existent customer service. I will look for another stand from a different company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When I say stay, I mean STAY!
customer_reviews.text: Many's the time I've decanted myself from the chromed steel beach cruiser I bike roll with, lookin' extra cool to all to who see me. My image is shattered moments later when the beast tips right over after I've put the kickstand down and headed into the bar for a cold one. From local winner to tourist loser in moments. No more will I suffer that humiliation since I've got the super duper dual kickstand. You've seen this style on big motorcycles many times and now I too can pedal with the big dogs. My chrome horse stay's where she is put, straight up, not laying on it's side, seemingly waiting to be put of it's misery!
customer_reviews.author: bikin' at the beach...

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works well
customer_reviews.text: I added a rear rack to my bike and started using it for grocery runs. The added weight of rack, basket, and cargo, however, changed the balance of the bike to the extent that I could no longer trust my old kickstand. I was pleased at how easily this mounted on my bike with the included plate, and adjusting the lower legs was easy too. It takes a little different technique to use the double kickstand—usually it involves lifting the front of the bike slightly—but I'm finding that it is well worth it for the added stability of a nice, upright position for the bike while loading.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. V.

customer_reviews.title: Long Legs. Solid. Adaptable.
customer_reviews.text: For a double-legged stand, fairly lightweight. Sturdy. Mounts well and there's a bit of variability with the mounting. Mine was a bit too close to the crankarm/pedal of the left (non-chainring) side, but I was able to twist it out of the way and clamp it down using the very large hex-headed bolt supplied with the stand. A little WD-40 has it folding and unfolding easily. I will say this... mine is adjusted all the way down (shortest leg length) and it is just the correct size. It's a 58 cm frame and the bottom bracket is pretty high... a less-tall frame might have problems with leg length.
customer_reviews.author: snailmartyr

customer_reviews.title: A great, stable kickstand for your bike!
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive kickstand works great at keeping your bike upright. Other one-side only kickstands made my bike lean over, which was problematic when trying to load gear onto my bike, as the weight would make it tip. This one is nice and solid with the two legs. The legs are adjustable in height through simple screws, though I did not need to make any adjustments. While the legs are more bulky than a single leg kickstand, this one remains out of the way (an obvious must).
customer_reviews.author: Keith C.

customer_reviews.title: Very stable
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my Specialized Sirrus Medium. It is surprisingly stable even though the legs don't protrude out very far. It has good, solid action on both deploying and retracting it. It is superior to a regular kickstand. The tradeoffs are that it is larger, both visualize and actually size. And you have to lift the back tire up a bit to deploy and retract the kickstand. I'm very happy overall.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: I don't feel like it will last as long as my "real"
customer_reviews.text: Kind of flimsy. The adjustable part on the bottom of the kickstand is plastic. It has held up okay, and it is easier to adjust that the all metal dual legged stands that require you to saw off the excess stand. When the bike is on the stand, it moves around as the plastic flexes. I don't feel like it will last as long as my "real", all metal dual legged stand. If it breaks soon, I will update this review to 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best kickstand
customer_reviews.text: It's like heaven and earth compared to the usual flimsy one-leg kickstands... those easily break and cause your bike to slowly but surely tip over on any unstable surface. This one is steady and leave your bike standing proudly upright and perpendicular even if you aren't. Two bolts (one short one long) made it easy to install, the legs are individually adjustable, do not hesitate to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Glebonator

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: The only suggested improvement to this product involves using some type of lock thread on the bolt that secures this kickstand to the frame. Mine kept loosing up until I used some and it's a bit tricky to get all the parts together while trying to balance the bike at the same time. Other than that, it's a great product and keeps the bike very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Hacker15

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 10 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this product. I have a commuter bike and bike to work everyday with panniers on my bike. The kick stand seemed sturdy and worked well. After 10 weeks it started to fail. It no longer works and I needed to put my original kick stand back on my bike. It seems like I will need to try a different manufacturer. If you do buy this product, make sure you keep the original packaging, because it is nearly impossible to find manufacturer info on the web to use a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D. Meltzer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap bolt made product unusable in a remote setting
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a week until the cheap bolt that you use to bolt the kickstand to your bike sheared clean off. Usually this wouldn't be a major hassle, but I was using the bike to tow a wagon full of camera gear at Burning Man, and if you don't have a kickstand and your bike is attached to a wagon and you are 90 miles from a bike store it is a huge pain in the butt to deal with. Why the cheap aluminum bolt when you're gonna attach it to a steel frame? Had hoped that this product would make life easier but I would have been better off with the stock kickstand. :(
customer_reviews.author: Michael Holden

customer_reviews.title: PREFECT & AWESOME, & I HAD MY CONCERNS ABOUT WIND BLOWING IT OVER TO ONE SIDE OR THE OTHER!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting strong winds (where I live <South Dade, Florida> we have very strong winds a lot & am excluding hurricanes); but the bicycle has only been blown over once. I cannot say how awesome this is, even have a friend who after helping me install it and seeing me use it, is going to buying one for himself. I love that I can lift my back wheel and frame off the ground, & the distance off the ground can be adjusted (significant enough to work on the back- wheel and/or frame)!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason 'Great White'-

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty good kickstand
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good kickstand. I wish that they had provided a slightly longer mounting bolt, and that the bracket were slightly thinner, so it routed better underneath my gear and brake cables. You have to be mindful that the kickstand doesn't hit your pedals, as even when tightened down, it can slide out a bit and hit them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Cavnar

customer_reviews.title: I ended up getting a side mounted unit and liked it enough to purchase 2 more for the bikes ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a total of 7 bikes and this stand wouldn't fit on any of them. Most of the issue is because of the cable routing but there is really just one mounting option for this and it didn't work. It's also very, very heavy (if you are concerned about weight). I ended up getting a side mounted unit and liked it enough to purchase 2 more for the bikes I had that were missing stands.
customer_reviews.author: DWood

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I found this stand to be a waste of money. The legs do not have a wide enough spread to stabilize my bike. It did hold the bike up even though the bike is very back heavy however, it took almost no effort for the bike to want to tip over. It did not perform any better on a light weight bike either. If you are looking for something that you don't have to worry about, do yourself a favor and don't buy this. I ended up spending the extra money and getting the one from URSUS Wheels and eating the loss on this one. Trust me, most sidestands are more stable than this.
customer_reviews.author: Buzyrd

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy but still the bike can easily tip if kid ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a child seat on my bike so to get my kid in while holding the bike was hard. This made it easier. It's sturdy but still the bike can easily tip if kid is off balance. Can't just put him in seat with stand but it helps alot in loading / unloading. Easy to install, adjustable. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McGregor

customer_reviews.title: measure your bike first
customer_reviews.text: The top clamp on this kickstand is 2 1/8" wide... which is just a little too short for my Gary Fisher mountain bike. On most bikes you will clamp this kickstand between the 2 chain stay tubes (the horizontal tubes that extend to the rear axle). Make sure the outside-to-outside distance of the chain stay tubes is <2".
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: GOOD ENOUGH FOR THE PRICE. NOT PERFECT.
customer_reviews.text: Kick stand is okay, I like the adjustable legs. As other lower rated reviews noted, the spring mechanism seem a little bit weak. Some reviewers have reported that after a few months of continuous use the springs loosen up. Most people who are daily riders might encounter that. Personally I only ride my bicycle a couple of time per month so I think this will last longer than for someone who rides daily, but I can see this being a problem further down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Donny Brook

customer_reviews.title: Flawless holding up my commuter bike with panniers and basket
customer_reviews.text: My bike has gotten heavy and when parking it, the front basket weight always made the fork turn to one side on the old kickstand. With the new one, it creates a triangle with the front wheel, and two legs making a sturdy shape to keep the front tire aligned when parked! Solid and lifts rear tire in the air, so happy with this after I started loading down my bike
customer_reviews.author: JdmSkylineGtr

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but a little wobbly and not quite as practical as the other style.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this style kickstand for my motorized bike. I originally had the other style, which was much sturdier but I felt didn't raise high enough in it's up position. This one is nice but I hadn't factored that I might often want to push it out from more than one side of the bike. It's also pretty wobbly and could use some rubberized feet. If I had it to do over, I'd keep the straight Y style that I tried first.
customer_reviews.author: Jermy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: easy to work on gears and tiers will fit a 28 er
customer_reviews.text: this is not the sturdiest kick,but it works well with my 25 LB. Redline , wheels /chain /work the gears / this kick makes them all a lot more easy to work on. In sand or soft ground it will keep the bike upright,does not add much in weight to bikes and it fits my 29 er just barely. "This a great idea "
customer_reviews.author: Bubacat

customer_reviews.title: Product perfect fit and exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: It fit perfectly, and then functioned better than I expected. Its cam system is really rather amazing. I have been cycling for 40 years, and as a racer would never consider a kickstand on my bicycle. But with new bike project, had to display it, and leaning it against windows or counters was not a good option. Never considered the kickstand had evolved into this perfect thing that does what it does when you need it, and then tucks away so nicely you don't even know it is there, until you need it again.
customer_reviews.author: george tatum

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to help hold up my bicycle a little better than the stock stand. I have a large rear rack and the bicycle would always want to tip over unless the front wheel was just right. This new kickstand distributes the weight evenly and tucks up out of the way when riding. No more bike hitting the ground if the front tire moves! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ThatJeremySmith

customer_reviews.title: Like a motorcycle center stand.
customer_reviews.text: This is terrific, it’s light and stable enough for me. I’m a street rider. For a hint, one of your tires will be elevated slightly just like a motorcycle center stand. The bikes weight has to on the stand for stability. On my bike (700c) the front tire is off the ground about 1/2in. I recommend this stand it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product
customer_reviews.text: I just got this so I can't comment on durability, but it seems like a great design. The legs adjust with a bolt, so that's very secure right there. I'm a little worried about that since it means part of the leg is just plastic, but it feels like a strong compound with a slightly rubbery texture. The action of the kickstand itself is smooth. Some of these stands take up way too much space below the bottom bracket, but this one doesn't come much lower than a single leg stand. It holds the bike very steady.
customer_reviews.author: Guy in Philly

customer_reviews.title: the hardware is crap. The lock washer didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: The idea of it works but, the hardware is crap. The lock washer didn't work for me. You might be scratching your head and asking "How, what?". The lock washer is made out of a very pliable metal. When I tighten down the bolt, the washer spread open and went around the head of the bolt. The bolt is made of the same metal as the washer, as in the head stripped very easily. Go to your trusted hardware store and get what you need for this. Don't use the included hardware!
customer_reviews.author: Warren A. Wilson III

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty enough
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to use it for a fully panniered bikepacking trip on the C&O. After the second day it began failing at the connection, with the bolt stripping out the inside threads.
customer_reviews.author: bharris

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Fat Tire Bike like it was made for it. Unfortunately made Cheaply.
customer_reviews.text: After two weeks of having installed on my Mongoose Dolomite Fat Tire Mountain Bike one of the legs broke. Looked really nice but designed very bad made very poorly with cast aluminum. Just like all cast aluminum coming from, well need I say it. You obviously know. All poor quality made with cheap material. The kick stand made in another place would be great. Coming from China no.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyZ

customer_reviews.title: GREAT IDEA THAT JUST DIDN'T WORK FOR MY FAT BIKE
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat kickstand that I attempted to install on my Mongoose Dolomite. When installing, the stand must be cocked (about 20 degrees from parallel with the bike frame) in order to clear the 4 inch wide rear tire. My particular fitment issue is your heel will strike the kickstand when pedaling the bike. I plan to install it on one of my other (non fat tired) bikes. If you decide to purchase one of these nifty kickstands, you may consider adding a wheel stabilizer (see photo) to your order. It prevents the front tire from flopping over when you put it on the center stand.
customer_reviews.author: Dollar Bill

customer_reviews.title: It works nicely
customer_reviews.text: I like this kickstand. I run with rear panniers and wanted a kickstand that would keep the bike stable while I work with the panniers. I like the way it folds away. My only complaint was I had to loosen my front derailleurs to install it, as the bolt runs from the top down and there was not enough room to work the bolt. It would be nice if the bolt entered from underneath!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hogg

customer_reviews.title: Two are better than one.
customer_reviews.text: This works so much better than a traditional kickstand. Gone are the days of bikes sinking into the ground and tipping over. I often take the front tire off of my bike for transport. I simply put the kickstand down and then re-install the front tire. The bike sets perfectly fine with just the kickstand and rear tire on the ground. Wish I had this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: MLH706

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for a motorized bicycle.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my gas engine bicycle. Its easily adjustable, and I set it high enough to keep the rear wheel well off the ground when the motor is running or when I need to do maintenance on the chain. Folds flat against the frame when up, and it does not interfere with the pedals or the bike chain. Seems sturdy enough as well. Works for me!
customer_reviews.author: RAM-DOGS

customer_reviews.title: Nice option for the price. It's a kickstand so keep expectations in check
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lower profile than the first double kickstand I tried. Easy to install and no interference with riding. Plenty of clearance from the tire. Easy to operate and very stable on uneven or soft ground. Cons: Not quite stable enough if you have a bag of groceries on one side. It doesn't even have to be very heavy and it will fall over on me. The adjustable legs are a nice idea but it's already on the lowest setting and would be best if it could adjust down further.
customer_reviews.author: Todd a

customer_reviews.title: beuno!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this buy and most extremely likely to recommend it for every cyclist out there. very sturdy and saves my bicycle from scratching when leaned against object, or when thrown on the ground infront of every grocery store or at the park. Now my bike stands out not having to be thrown on the ground. I once bought one from ebay that didnt last 3 months, the thing came off while in motion, I searched in vain for it, then I decided to give this one a trial and it turns out this is what I need for my 29" mtb
customer_reviews.author: Maranathan

customer_reviews.title: Best kick stand for any bicycle
customer_reviews.text: I love it because it can adjust to fit any bicycle you use it on & with the parts that came with it saved me. I say this because the kick stand plate broke on my bike I was sad than I pulled out the extra parts & the piece I needed was there. I ride all year round in Indiana. The kick stand is still working as good as new. It holds my steel frame mountain bike with a bicycle trailer & panniers up with no problem. Buy it
customer_reviews.author: R. Houpt

customer_reviews.title: Takes a bit of tweaking, but works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: I need to position this fairly precisely to get it to work as it should without impeding my pedal whiles its down, or having it bump my tire when its deployed or being folded. With all that said, it works nicely now, and does let me monkey with my bike as needed.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: E-Bike Upgrade #1
customer_reviews.text: Besides the motor, this is one of the best upgrades I've made to my bike. It easily pivots the weight onto the stand and keeps the bike upright rather than leaning to the side. I feel much more confident about leaving my bike on this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Stewart Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It's alright...
customer_reviews.text: It's coming up on a year of owning this & I cannot say I'd buy it again. Not as sturdy as it needs to be. Really doesn't like uneven ground at all. I'm tired of my bike falling over at the slightest breeze... We've adjusted it many times... I don't know if we got a defective one or what....
customer_reviews.author: BrandyD

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Holds up very well to lots of use and abuse. As long as your bottom bracket is not too high, and your stays are parallel to the level ground it should mount up perfect and work very well. eg, not a good match for dual suspension mountain bike with high bottom bracket and angled stays.
customer_reviews.author: random customer

customer_reviews.title: works on folding bikes
customer_reviews.text: I put this kickstand on my Citizen Tokyo folding bike after getting tired of it falling over all the time. This thing is great - completely solid and does not interfere with the bike folding. The only down side is that it's a bit too tall for my 16" tires, but I just lift the back of the bike as I am putting the kickstand down and it's not that big a problem. It's worth the small extra effort for my bike not to flop all over me every time I park it somewhere. Install took less than 10 minutes and didn't require any extra parts.
customer_reviews.author: catethegreat

customer_reviews.title: All bikes should come stock with this!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product. Love the fit and how it works. Simple install and so much better than a simple kick stand. I get many compliments, and it is rock solid. I didn’t need to adjust it for my 27” wheeler. Great for any angle or terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on my daughter's bicycle. The OEM one never really worked. It was always falling down in the garage thus knocking other things down. Easy install and adjustment. Both arms folding to the left side of the bike is genius.
customer_reviews.author: J. HYDRICK

customer_reviews.title: Solid build and function
customer_reviews.text: Its perfect for my road touring bike. I have a saddle bag and other attachments that make the bike heavier than it already is. This stand was perfect and kept the bike stable. Only annoyance is the front wheel swings freely if you have a lot of weight at the back but its whatever. Its also very solidly built with some heft. Definitely get this for heavier bikes
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow can't say enough good things about this. If you have a bicycle with saddle bags, or extra weight this kickstand is a must. Works like a charm, looks fantastic, and the quality is of a very high standard. I highly recommend this kickstand if you need extra support it is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works grea!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I was looking for ina. Kickstand. I have a northrock xc00 from Costco it's a fatbike and it worked. Needed a longer bolt than the 2 inch provided. Can even turn cranks while the kickstand is down and can be used as a on the go repair stand kind of deal. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: ted nelson

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant product, easy installing and very stableP
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant product, easy installing and very stable. It might not be clear from the product pics but both legs of the kickstand fold to the left so they won’t interfere with the bike. Just brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: KKT

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over a side stand!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a spectacular improvement over the more typical one-sided stand that leans the bike to one side. It's amazing how much less floor space the bike takes up when standing fully upright. It also eliminates that annoying problem where the pedal gets sometimes ratcheted up against the swing path of a side stand. Build quality is also excellent, and the plastic legs at the bottom keep it from scuffing up hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: I ride nice trek internal geared and commute around town regularly
customer_reviews.text: I was really quite disappointing with this kickstand. I ride nice trek internal geared and commute around town regularly. I had been using a traditional single leg stand but would often feel unsteady with the weight in cargo bags or trailer. When someone said that this worked well with a cargo bike I took a shot and this has really under-preformed. This installed fairly well but really was no more steady than any the original. More importantly after three months of use the bolt it came with snapped of and is stuck inside the kickstand so that I cant unscrew it to use a new bolt. Really unimpressive.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Merten

customer_reviews.title: Some Modification Required
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut some of the kickstand's base plate, so it would not impinge the under BB rear derailleur cable. The bike has a kickstand mounting plate, so it was either modify it or return it. Also, I noticed the bike was unstable up on the kickstand. Then I saw that the bike was leaning. Adjusting one of the legs "up" one position, so that each leg was a different length, levelled the bike and fixed the stability problem. Another thing about it is that it is fairly heavy, but I think the added functionality outweighs it.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Traihead

customer_reviews.title: Holds up my E Bike
customer_reviews.text: It work on my 26" E Bike. The plastic legs are only extended a little on 26". Might be weaker on a 700c or 29er. I tried to buy more expensive all metal Swiss version from LBS and couldn't get a 26" size. Lets me park close to poles for locking without leaning on pole and scratching paint. Bike wanted to fall over with single stand and battery installed so seems necessary for me. Took one star off for plastic leg ends, and not rated for E Bikes. I hope they fix that.
customer_reviews.author: Retrorockit

customer_reviews.title: Really good, works awesome for the bike I put it on.
customer_reviews.text: I only give it 4 stars because I'm not sure it will work for everyone, and the longer bolt isn't an allen fitting. But other than that I wish I would have bought it for an earlier bike, as the one I bought before the rubber feet fell off in about a week, and the feet on this one bolt on and are adjustable which are a ++.. So before you purchase, make sure it's the right one for you, this one works for the bike I put it on.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This kickstand is good until you actually try to use it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in June 2017 for a women's Giant Sedona comfort bike. After limited use, the fold-out leg for the right side of the bike is now so loose that the bike just falls over and won't stand up at all. Buyer beware! This kickstand is good until you actually try to use it, it's definitely not durable at all I wish I would have bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T.

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand. It says not to use it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great kickstand. It says not to use it for your e-bike, but that's what I use it for. The legs are individually adjustable, which is a great feature. If you have heavy panniers on one side of you bike you can adjust the legs to lean the bike and account for this. All my friends are amazed by its folding mechanism! The only downside I found is, since this kickstand lifts the front end of your bike into the air, the front wheel is free to rotate, which doesn't hurt anything, but looks silly.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B.

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow for Sloped/Uneven Surfaces
customer_reviews.text: The footprint is too narrow to support my 26" mountain bike when it is loaded with groceries or when the surface is not level (or dirt or gravel) as is the case almost everywhere in Central America where I live. Really nice design, well built and nice kick action but just too narrow for my environment. I bought a BV regular/single leg Adjustable Bike Kickstand and it is terrific. It's also easily adjustable on the spot for different slopes.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: The best stand out there
customer_reviews.text: The best stand out there. Very sturdy and well built center stand that folds both legs to one side like a side stand. It lifts up the rear wheel for chain maintenance and adjusting gears. You can also put a piece of wood underneath to lift the wheel even more.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of the kickstand, my problem with it is that it's not very sturdy. I Have a basket on the back and when I put something in it the bike leans to one side and sometimes will fall over, the feet are to small. That's the reason I wanted a center double kickstand to prevent that from happening. Yes I'll be returning it and hopefully the THIRD one will work
customer_reviews.author: Jethro Daniel Perez

customer_reviews.title: This solid design, works great for me!
customer_reviews.text: After a day of thought, I had to figure out how to modify the mounting as my shifting cable were very, very close.. One home Depot stainless steel Socket Cap Screw and then this stand was "good to go" It is far superior to kick stands I've had over the years. Note at lowest adjustment it still raises my front (or back wheel if may bags are loaded) off ground about an inch. I can live with that as this is a strong stand and with two legs for balance I don't think my bike will fall over. So far very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: A "must have" for motorized bikes !
customer_reviews.text: for the price, this is really nice for motorized bikes. it allows you to kickstart the bike without having to hold up the back end of the bike, while also allowing you to check wheel alignment, or if you're checking for gear and chain wobble. the kickstand allows your bike to be closer to a wall without having to lean it or worry about it falling over. only downside I've noticed is that it has a tendency to bump into the wheel but only when you try to bring it back up. overall great kickstand !. definitely would look into getting more for my other bikes :)
customer_reviews.author: John doe

customer_reviews.title: Very handy when pulling a trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product to prevent bike from falling over when loading and unloading trailer. It works when on level ground but for loading on a grade a makeshift brake on trailer was necessary. It also comes in handy for rear shifter adjustments, but you have weigh down the front tire. The bike sit on the stand and rear tire, the opposite of a motorcycle center stand. Great product. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great Kickstand!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best kickstand I've every seen. I was in the market for a decent kickstand because my aluminum one broke. I wasn't looking for anything fancy, but the reviews and the reasonable price caught my attention. I'm very pleased now that I'm using it and it appears that the quality is excellent. Should last a long time. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH

customer_reviews.title: easy to install little tricky to get used to balance it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, but takes getting to know the bike to balance it correctly. It definitely works sand I highly recommend this kick stand. I love that it can lean either way.
customer_reviews.author: M. James

customer_reviews.title: Crappy attachment
customer_reviews.text: The spring mechanism and design are awesome! It's the attachment to a bicycle which really sucks. I had to use the longer screw that is provided. I bought two of these and on both of them the hole to screw in the screw stripped because it's soft metal. I have to kickstands that work great rendered junk because I can't attach it because whoever designed it did a poor job or the metal is subpar
customer_reviews.author: matthew wayne o'brien

customer_reviews.title: Love the stability of it
customer_reviews.text: Wish it could go a bit shorter so the wheel wasn't so far off the ground when parked, as it tends to swing my handlebars all the way around. Love the stability of it. I need to buy a longer bolt to get it to fit onto my bike properly, it keeps falling off because the bolt is just a tiny bit too short.
customer_reviews.author: ma kuns mama

customer_reviews.title: Great Kickstand
customer_reviews.text: What a great kickstand. Not only does it provide more stability when supporting my bicycle, but its multi-level feature allows me to service the bicycle more easily (and without inverting, repositioning, etc., it), i.e., clean, oil, and maintain the chain and derailleur, make adjustments, etc. It is also positioned so as not to interfere with the chain, or any cables or hydraulic fluid lines. (Mike Pitch [The Vicious Cycle,West Islip, NY] where I purchased my bicycles, is quite impressed by this kickstand and its versatility.)
customer_reviews.author: madecillis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Kick stand!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must buy for your bike, it keep the bike standy sturdy. I don't have to worry about it falling, it stand straight or leaning to one side. I am happy I purchase this kick stand
customer_reviews.author: Ben Dagrin

customer_reviews.title: Nice once you get it on.
customer_reviews.text: Took me a good part of the evening putting this on my Trek bike huge pain. I would suggest really thin bar with a slim socket 9/16. Be careful not to force the thread on for obvious reasons. In my case I used the T-50 because the length needed to be short. You'll want to flip the bike upside down for comfort and low seating for leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. bought this to replace the one that came with my bike. This one I really like because it stands my bike in a straight upright instead of leaning .
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: Not enough leg adjustability
customer_reviews.text: Not adjustable enough as far as height goes, wheels need to be able to contact with ground or as desired. I have a large bike with 700c tires and with this kick either the back or front would be significantly raised of the surface, no option to adjust further. That wont work especially with a heavy bag on the front or back rack or both, leading to instability It is a good idea just a poor design in this case. I returned for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Bob WellerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Happy kickstand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cyclocross bike when I started hauling panniers on bike trips. Very easy to install, and very sturdy. However, the plastic protective boot on one leg went lost in the first week. I did contact the company, because they have a year satisfaction promise, and they sent me a replacement part very quickly. Happy with their response.
customer_reviews.author: Run Sassenach

customer_reviews.title: Very highly reccomended
customer_reviews.text: It stabilizes the bike very very well. I have a Fat Tire beach cruiser with Ape Hanger handlebars so the bike is very front heavy and a regular kickstand (the origional) wasn't holding the bike up very well but this not only does the jod great but looks great at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: It is one of the best products I have bought for my bike
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when ordering this, but witht the included braket (i don't have a spot on my bike) and very little room I got it on. I did put electrical tape down so it wouldn't scratch the frame. It is one of the best products I have bought for my bike!!! Only reason it didn't get 5 stars is that the stand will not go back up on its own and I have to kick it up.
customer_reviews.author: MSU

customer_reviews.title: Stable but a little too tall
customer_reviews.text: This stand is strong and stable. My bike does not tip over while using it. It was easy to install. My bike has a medium woman's frame and my back wheel comes off the ground when the stand is down....it's a little too tall. But it folds up nicely. I'd give it 5 stars if it could be shortened a little more
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Almost Stands Up by Itself
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand was breeze to install, looks sharp and when I kicked it to stand up my bike, it practically stood itself up. You can actually stand it up with one hand. The center cradling of it keeps it from leaning so the front tire doesn't turn into itself.
customer_reviews.author: Ronelson

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap materials used
customer_reviews.text: If I were you, I'd pass on this one. Just barely tightening the main bolt caused the threading to strip. After that it was useless. The threads are built into the main piece. Extremely cheap metal used to make this. No wonder it was priced so low.
customer_reviews.author: LotusStyle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, keeps bike upright.
customer_reviews.text: Love my center kickstand very sturdy was easy to install. Holds my bike upright, never having to worry about bike tipping over. Folds nicely under bike, will not interfere with pedals.
customer_reviews.author: F. A. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kickstand in March of 2015. I have used it on two different bikes. It went on easily on both bikes, the second one required the mounting plate. Worked great until this morning when one leg broke. Totally useless now. Not repairable. May 18, 2017 BikePak customer service sent me a Complaint Resolution note with an invalid phone number. Apparently, they have little desire or competence to resolve this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Ballow

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have this on a 80lbs electric fat bike and works great you do need to tighten it about once a week but that has more to do with the weight and speed my bike achieves
customer_reviews.author: Ward Family

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike stand do far. Doing what it's suppose to.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this a couple days ago but seems solid so far. I was leaning my bike against the wall for past 2 years and this is much better.
customer_reviews.author: T Haleon

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement for a standard kick stand.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and adjust for height. I have been very impressed with the performance so far, it seems pretty solid. I've been asked quite a few times where I got it as it's pretty unique.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Buy this kickstand if you want something that is advertised to do what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Kick stand was exactly as I had hoped strong and lightweight, I will be purchasing this product again. I did manage to break it. But of no fault to the manufacturing of the kick stand itself. More of big truck small bike circumstances. When I do replace it will be of the same manufacture. Great Product right up until the accident. Even held my single wheeled trailer steady, as well the bike. Impressed I was.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbo

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: The stock kickstand that came with the cruiser buckled under the added weight of a 2 stroke engine. This double leg kickstand distributes the weight and my bike doesn't fall over anymore. The adjustable legs give me the option to add enough height to lift the back tire for when I need to work on the bike. If you are looking for sturdy kickstand then I highly suggest this one.
customer_reviews.author: H. CrockerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful kickstand! Been riding with it for a month. And so far, works perfect every time. Solid construction and nice mechanics. I have both front and back racks, so I wanted a double-leg stand that kept the bike level. This stand puts the rear wheel up off the ground about an inch, so you could use it for making roadside drivetrain adjustments. My Fuji Touring has a bracket for extra spoke storage right where the top plate of a kickstand goes and other stands have a top plate that was too thick for clearance. The BV model has a low profile plate that seems to be just as sturdy and easily clears the spoke bracket.
customer_reviews.author: z

customer_reviews.title: FITS a 29er!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a center stand for my 29er. This stand fits even on the lowest adjustment. Sturdy, and lets you do things like brakes and chain work. Heavy duty spring is easy to deploy and retract and lightweight. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer 2020

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for commuter with heavy panniers.
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine - it's a little more effort than the classic one-legged kick-stand, but more stable. I have a tendency to load all kinds of things in my bike baskets (folding Wald wire baskets) and with the side kick-stand, my bike was always listing or falling down. This works very well. You have to get used to kicking it up and off to the side to get it to fold up, but once you get the hang of it, it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Commentator

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well balanced
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!!! Installation was simple and easy to apply!! Oh yea it balances it pretty good that im not scare for my 1000 bike to fall down
customer_reviews.author: lmandap

customer_reviews.title: Its SUPER nice. My bike is standing straight up and ...
customer_reviews.text: Its SUPER nice. My bike is standing straight up and is very secure. The only con, I have to lift the back of my bike to sweep the stand down OR up. The stand isn't too big for the bike. Just seems to be the way it is. I purchased this to securely prostrate my bike when I hooked up a child trailer, but lifting to bike to lower the stand and then raise it will complicate things I believe. Will update if its a problem
customer_reviews.author: Verified

customer_reviews.title: Works great !
customer_reviews.text: After searching a lot, I found this device and it was a solution, very good quality and utility, I recommend 100%!
customer_reviews.author: jose guarnieri

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy stand
customer_reviews.text: I had converted a bike to front wheel drive e-bike and the weight was too unbalanced for the stock side stand. This has been the ideal solution
customer_reviews.author: Steve Rahm

product_meta.title: BV Bike Kickstand, Center Mount Bicycle Stand - Length Adjustable, Foldable Double Leg for 24"-28" Bikes
product_meta.description:
BV Double Leg, Adjustable & Foldable Bicycle Kickstand for Size 24"-28"



Aluminum Alloy - Sturdy & Build to Last

BV black adjustable and foldable double leg kickstand is a sturdy way to prop the bike when not riding.
The double kickstand protects bike chains from getting caught when lowering kickstand to the ground.

Adjustable Height for Size 24" - 28"

Adjustable height for bicycle sizes 24 in -28 in. Patented design. For trekking, mountain, or city riding.
Bike Compatibility: City/Road Bikes, Mountain Bikes and Trekking Bikes.

Note: Not for use on E-Bikes.

BV is continuously improving and evolving for our customer needs. Our goal is your 100% satisfaction.
We offer every customer a limited one-year product warranty on every item purchased.
feature_bullets: Adjustable & foldable double leg kickstand is a sturdy way to prop your bike!
Protects bike chains from getting caught when lowering kickstand to the ground.
Patented design. For trekking, mountain, or city riding.
Note: Not for use on E-Bikes.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
